intro: Cottendorfia pearcei, commonly known as the Texas star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant produces small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
